text: From the Sports Gazette, issue of 6 August 1879. We are pleased to report that Mr. F. Jacobs, although severely damaged and kicked by the fall he suffered while riding Mrs. Jones at Southport, at the Consolation Derby, is quite recovered, as much as his best friends might wish, and is already out of danger. Question from the editor: Did the gentleman actually run into Mrs. Jones, or in the excitement, and given her age, was it the looseness of the pussy that made her fall from such a beautiful group? FIN
title: Noticia deportiva
author: nan Anónimo
